overall_summary: The reasoning trajectory demonstrates a practical approach to forecasting hourly time-series data with clear daily seasonality. It identifies key patterns in the data, evaluates multiple forecasting methods, and selects a simple averaging technique due to limited historical data. The approach focuses on leveraging observed daily cycles while acknowledging data constraints and trade-offs between simplicity and model sophistication.
common_data_patterns: Complete historical data (no missing values in provided series)
key_insights: Daily seasonality is the dominant and most reliable pattern for forecasting with limited data
Simple averaging of corresponding hours across historical days provides a practical baseline for short-term forecasts
Complex models (SARIMA, Exponential Smoothing) are impractical with only 4 days of historical data
Trend analysis is limited by the short observation period
Forecast horizon (96 hours) matches the seasonality period, enabling pattern repetition
complexity_analysis: Moderately complex: Combines pattern recognition with method evaluation, includes detailed numerical computations, and justifies trade-offs between sophistication and data limitations, though ultimately implements a straightforward solution.
